channel.title: RS Cache Downloader
channel.description:
[size=6]RS Cache Downloader (RSCD)[/size]
[b]Update January 1st, 2014: Increased maximum file size.[/b] [b]Update August 22nd, 2013: Added support for the new sound server and added temporary fix for index 14 bug.[/b] [b]Update June 25th, 2013: Updated the protocol.[/b] [b]Update June 8th, 2013: Updated the protocol and increased the maximum file size.[/b] [b]Update November 28th, 2012: Updated the protocol and fixed a logic error.[/b] [b]Update October 25th, 2012: Updated the protocol.[/b] [b]Update February 17th, 2012: Added support for a larger range of files.[/b] [b]Update January 7th, 2012: Modified the protocol to be consistent with the newest clients.[/b] [b]Update November 15th, 2011: Updated the protocol to be consistent with the current client. Currently, the tool assumes that the minor version number will always be 1. If this isn't the case, it will fail to identify the correct client version. Please let me know if this happens so that I can address this issue.[/b] [b]Update August 31st, 2011: Updated the ReferenceTable class to mirror the functionality in the newest client.[/b] [b]Update December 22nd, 2010: Made a small change to the ReferenceTable class that fixed an issue I created when rewriting it. Also, a change was made in CacheDownloader to allow for the downloading of the contents of index 35 when it's finally used.[/b] [b]Update December 6th, 2010: Made a small update to the ReferenceTable class to eliminate the use of null Entry objects.[/b] [b]Update December 4th, 2010: Uploaded the files again, since they were removed for some reason. I've replaced the Whirlpool class and rewritten the ReferenceTable class also.[/b] [b]Update November 26th, 2010: Fixed a bug that was introduced during testing that caused the program to stop after a timeout instead of reconnecting.[/b] [b]Update November 25th, 2010: Updated it to work with the latest clients (629+) and replaced CacheIndex with FileStore. Thanks light232 for some sample code using the FileChannel class.[/b] [b]Update August 25th, 2010: Updated it to work with the latest clients (615+)[/b] [b]Update August 20th, 2010: Added the capability to update from a previous cache instead of downloading the entire cache again.[/b]
[size=4]Overview[/size]
This is a tool I recently updated and rewrote that will request and download the cache from the RS servers just like the client does. However, this manages to download the entire cache much faster than the client, since the client does this passively as it is running the game. From my tests, it is able to download the entire cache in just under thirty minutes.
I've tried to document what each class and method are responsible for, with the exception of the class that hashes the data using the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whirlpool_%28cryptography%29]Whirlpool algorithm[/url]. If you have any questions, comments, or improvements you'd like me to be aware of, feel free to post in this thread. Enjoy!
[size=4]Download[/size]
[url=http://www.mediafire.com/download/5u2c416ia1dph4v/rscd.zip]MediaFire[/url]

item.title: RS Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

There was another protocol change and a silly logic error in my code, but it should be up-to-date!

edit on June 8th, 2013:
The protocol was updated again, so I’ve modified the tool to be up-to-date. I’ve also increased the maximum file size to be consistent with the current client.

The protocol changes may enable faster downloading of resources, which is a big win for everyone! Try it out and see if you notice any differences.

edit on June 25th, 2013:
Yet another update changed the protocol a bit, but everything should be working again.

edit on August 22nd, 2013:
I’ve uploaded a new version to the first post. It includes support for the new sound server (index 40 files) and hopefully avoids the bug with index 14. Let me know if you guys have any problems.

Read full topic

i get this error when tryin to run it [code]
C:\Users\Justin\Desktop\rscd>java -cp out com.method.rscd.CacheDownloader
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/method/rs
cd/CacheDownloader : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)

at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: com.method.rscd.CacheDownloader. Program will ex
it.

C:\Users\Justin\Desktop\rscd>pause
Press any key to continue . . .
[/code]
[/quote]
I get the same error? How do i change it so it run’s with my java?[/quote]

Try downloading the newest Java version (looks like 7u4) from here.

item.title: RS Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @wildone500m wildone500m
item.description:
@wildone500m wrote:

[quote=“Method, post:71, topic:352754”][quote author=wildone500m link=topic=449072.msg3974726#msg3974726 date=1334518737]

1 step closer to having a complete 712 server

Is it supposed to repeat “Requested ##,####”?

Yes, though it shouldn’t be requesting the same files over and over again. If it is, something’s not working properly.

It’s supposed to install in under 30 mins right? Well, It kept doing requested 14,0001 all the way up to around 14,10000 then i got impatient and closed it. It took almost an hour and it still didnt even install…
[/quote]

Well, it’s not “installing”. It has to download every single resource from the RuneScape servers, and that can take a while to do if your connection is slow. It should work much quicker after the first run (if you’re just updating the resources that you downloaded previously).[/quote]

Im on wireless with a 2 bar connection

Read full topic

item.title: RS Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:

[quote=“wildone500m, post:70, topic:352754”][quote author=Method link=topic=449072.msg3974466#msg3974466 date=1334501556]

1 step closer to having a complete 712 server

Is it supposed to repeat “Requested ##,####”?

Yes, though it shouldn’t be requesting the same files over and over again. If it is, something’s not working properly.
[/quote]

It’s supposed to install in under 30 mins right? Well, It kept doing requested 14,0001 all the way up to around 14,10000 then i got impatient and closed it. It took almost an hour and it still didnt even install…[/quote]

Well, it’s not “installing”. It has to download every single resource from the RuneScape servers, and that can take a while to do if your connection is slow. It should work much quicker after the first run (if you’re just updating the resources that you downloaded previously).

item.title: RS Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:60, topic:352754”][quote author=Method link=topic=449072.msg3923711#msg3923711 date=1329973014]

Also, I don’t see any license details, do you have a license or are you just releasing it to the public domain?

Neither.
[/quote]
I think it has to be one or the other, you either release it into the public domain (anyone can do whatever they want with it, modify, re-release, sell, etc etc), or you release it under a particular license. It lets whoever uses it (like me) know what they can and can’t do.[/quote]

This page suggests otherwise, but I’m not a lawyer or expert on copyright law.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:60, topic:352754”][quote author=Method link=topic=449072.msg3923711#msg3923711 date=1329973014]

I’d like to just make a few changes so that, since I already download and parse the parameters in my script, that I can just send this program that info so it doesn’t have to do it again, and of course share the source code like everything else related to that script. Lastly, if I make those changes so that it optionally takes command line arguments in replacement of getting the information itself, would you use that code to update for future versions so I don’t have to re-do my changes every update? A patch would probably do most of it for me, but I’m just curious.

You’d be on your own to implement this functionality.
[/quote]
Of course, I wasn’t asking you to do it. Just asking if you might be willing to roll my changes into your program after I am done, of course assuming you like the implementation and such.[/quote]

It’s possible, but as of now, I think I’d rather have the code remain as-is.

Read full topic
